news.title: Layoff announcements this year top 1.1 million, the most since 2020 when pandemic hit, Challenger says
news.summary: The firm said layoff plans totaled 76,835 in November. That's a step down from October but still enough to bring the 2025 total up to 1.17 million.

news.title: Bids for WBD are in. Here's what Paramount, Comcast and Netflix could do with the assets
news.summary: WBD's coveted library of content includes franchises like DC's superheroes, Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, Game of Thrones, Looney Tunes and Scooby-Doo.

news.title: Nvidia has a cash problem — too much of it
news.summary: . Nvidia's recent slew of billion-dollar checks highlight the company's growing cash pile. Nvidia is a leading supplier of graphics cards to the PC industry.

news.title: GM’s new ‘Silicon Valley cowboy’ eyes technology renaissance for automaker
news.summary: GM Chief Product Officer Sterling Anderson has consolidated power to oversee "the end-to-end product lifecycle" of manufacturing, engineering and software.

news.title: Fanatics lands retail and merchandising deal for 2026 FIFA World Cup
news.summary: The 2026 World Cup is set to be played next summer across the U.S., Mexico and Canada. The in-venue retail operations will be led by Fanatics.

news.title: Americans’ affordability crisis isn’t tariffs’ fault — it’s something much, much deeper
news.summary: Costs for housing, food, healthcare, child care and energy were rising long before Trump’s trade war. Costs for the ‘Unaffordability Five’ — housing,Food, Healthcare, Child care and Energy — were rising before Trump.

news.title: Strategist who nailed stocks, bonds and oil this year warns of ‘optimism shakeout’ in early 2026
news.summary: Overly optimistic sentiment may need a reset early on, says strategist Warren Pies. Look for more AI adoption to help broaden the stock market next year, he says.

news.title: AI can help many things — but it can’t fix bad CEOs and their money mistakes
news.summary: Job layoffs are being pinned on AI — when poor leadership is really to blame. The U.S. needs to stop blaming AI for job losses and start looking for the root cause.

news.title: Market forecasts are usually wrong — but this inflation-fighting investment can see the future
news.summary: ‘It’s tough to make predictions, especially about the future,’ Yogi Berra said. He could have been talking about Wall Street.

news.title: Dollar General sees more customer traffic at stores, something its top rival didn’t have
news.summary: Dollar General’s stock rallies as sales rose more than expected and the company took market share from its rivals. Dollar General shares are up more than 3% in the past week.
